channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023070956
item.description:
Report X-2023070956

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic jerrican began leaking during unloading at the facility. Item may have been damaged prior to arrival at our facility. Can was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and moved to the damage area. Spilled liquid was cleaned up with absorbent pads. DescribePack: Small puncture on bottom of plastic can at the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery the can was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and the spilled liquid was cleaned up with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023070796
item.description:
Report X-2023070796

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto a old to fill trailer to be moved the next day. Package was found leaking in trailer and taken out of trailer for clean up. DescribePack: Package was in good shape except the bottom had been blow out from the leakage. Bottle inside had a loose cap and a dent on the side. DurationRel: 13 and MitigateEffect: package was put into Hazmat tote and sat up right.

item.title: Report X-2023080135
item.description:
Report X-2023080135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICABLY WET ON TOP UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS NOTICED THAT ALL 4 1 GAL JUGS HAD FAILED DUE TO LOOSE CAPS AND NO INNER PACKAGING. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILED AT THE TOP DUE TO POOR CLOSURES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM OTHERS

item.title: Report X-2023070700
item.description:
Report X-2023070700

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICABLY WET AND TORN UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ALL 4 1 GAL JUGS HAD FAILED DUE TO POOR INNER PACKAGING AND LOOSE LIDS. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILED AT THE TOP DUE TO POOR CLOSURES AND AT THE BODY DUE TO POOR INNER PACKAGING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM OTHERS

item.title: Report X-2023070685
item.description:

  • Description: 1. X-2023070685 SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICABLY WET UPON INSPECTION IT WAS NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT THAT HAD FAILED DUE TO POOR CLOSURES CAUSING SOME OF ITS CONTENTS TO LEAK. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE HAD FAILED DUE TO POOR CAPS AND INNER PACKAGING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM OTHERS. 2. X-2023070686 SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICABLY WET UPON INSPECTION IT WAS NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT THE PACKAGE HAD FAILED DUE TO POOR CLOSURES AND INNER PACKAGING CAUSING SOME OF ITS LIQUID TO SPILL DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILED AT THE TOP DUE TO POOR CLOSURES AND INNER PACKAGING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM OTHERS

item.title: Report X-2023061333
item.description:
Report X-2023061333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A leaking package was discovered at the INDH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained a metal drum that had a damaged bottom chime. The package was place into a steel salvage package and a nwe declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023061330
item.description:
Report X-2023061330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8 the package was discovered to be leaking. The package was marked as a Class 3 Flammable Liquid. DG Admin instructed the station to place the package into a steel salvage drum and contact the shipper to have this sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070711
item.description:
Report E-2023070711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the cap was loose on one of the poly 55 gallon drum of carusol (un3214) and that 2 ounces had been released due to improper preparation for shipping. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060787
item.description:
Report X-2023060787

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A steel drum containing a class 3 fell off the belt during sort operations at the INDH facility. The fall damaged the cap causing a release. The drum was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
